title: 107_hr344
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. This includes amending section 223(a)(2) to determine benefit amounts and repealing the defined term in section 223(c)(2). Section 223(a)(2) of the Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 is amended to remove specified language and clarify benefit determination. Additionally, section 223(c)(2) is repealed, with conforming amendments made to section 223(c) for consistency. Section 223(c)(1) of the Social Security Act is amended to clarify benefit determination. Section 202(e)(1)(F) is also amended regarding Widow's Insurance Benefits Based on Disability. Section 202(e) of the Social Security Act is amended to eliminate a defined term. Section 202(f)(1)(F) is also amended to clarify Widower's Insurance Benefits Based on Disability. Section 202(f)(1)(F) of the Social Security Act is amended to clarify the eligibility for insurance benefits based on disability. This includes the elimination of a defined term and redesignation of certain paragraphs within the Act. Elimination of waiting period for disability and Medicare benefits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability and Medicare benefits. Amendments include removing specific time requirements for entitlement to benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate waiting periods for disability and Medicare benefits, removing specific time requirements for entitlement to benefits. Amendments include changes to the entitlement criteria for railroad retirement beneficiaries. Amendments to the Social Security Act eliminate waiting periods for disability and Medicare benefits, removing specific time requirements for entitlement. Changes also affect entitlement criteria for railroad retirement beneficiaries. Amendments to the Railroad Retirement Act remove waiting periods for entitlement to an annuity, eliminating specific time requirements. Amendments to the Railroad Retirement Act remove waiting periods for entitlement to an annuity, eliminating specific time requirements. Effective dates are specified in Section 5. The amendments in this Act apply to Social Security benefits based on disability, with specific effective dates outlined. The amendments in this Act apply to Social Security benefits based on disability, with specific effective dates outlined for different sections. The changes will impact benefits for months following the enactment of the Act, applications for disability determinations filed under title II, and insurance benefits under title XVIII for items and services furnished at least 90 days after the enactment date.
